label: Detect Archive & Integrity Check
info: This workflow identifies different types of archive types and runs integrity checks based on the archiving tool

name: v1.0 File Upload List Files
info:
# List files

Will list files in a directory.

Path can be set in `msg.payload` or by setting the `DIRECTORY` environment variable.

Extensions can be filtered by settings the `EXTENSIONS` environment variable to an Array of extensions.

name: Upload
Error
func: node.error(`Error: only ${env.get('EXTENSIONS')} files are allowed.`, msg)

name: Set-Log2timeline CLI params
Timesketch CLI params
Double click on Queue Zips to the adjust bulk processing value
info: Tweak the value to configure how many archives to process at any given time

name: READ ME FIRST! Double Click
info:
**CURRENT CONFIG OF THE AUTOMATION DO NOT PROCESS NESTED ZIPS OF HOSTS.FOR EXAMPLE, YOU CANNOT UPLOAD A SINGLE ZIP CONTAINING TRIAGE ARCHIVES OF N DIFFERENT HOSTS.**

**Following folders need to be created beforehand**
/cases/processor - this is where archives will need to be copied to. Note that the original archives copied here will be retained indefinitely.
/cases/plaso - this is where plaso files be stored after log2timeline completes its processing.
/cases/evtxproc/ -processed hayabusa csvs will be stored here.

**Hayabusa Evtx Processing***
This is currently configured for KAPE triage configurations, where the evtx is expected like below
unzipped directory/C/Windows/System32/winevt/. You can change the path by updating the path in Hayabusa Process Variables node. You must change the timesketch username and password information in the same node. Otherwise it will fail to ingest to Timesketch

***Slack notifications***
You must set the slack webhook and username configuration within the "Notification to Slack" node within "Slack Notifications" flow 

Make sure Node-RED can read and write to all folders under /cases.

**Compression utility must be pre-installed on the Linux host prior running the workflow**
This automation is configured to detect Zip, RAR, Tar GZ & BZ2, 7z archives.

** "Variable Setup" node** 
This node contains the key commandline parameters used for archive tools and other variables required for automation.

**You need the following Node-RED nodes installed via the Node-RED palette**

-node-red-contrib-fs 
-node-red-contrib-fs-ops 
-node-red-contrib-simple-queue 
-node-red-contrib-watchdirectory
-node-red-contrib-slack-files

**Change the Log2Timeline CLI Parameters and Timesketch CLI Parameters**
You should review the CLI parameters used for Log2timeline and Timesketch in their respective nodes. 


**FYI Only**
Node-RED has a default memory cap of 2GB. You can increase this through the use of environment variables. Add the following to your bash.rc of the user in which Node-RED runs. Size is in MB.

NODE_OPTIONS=--max_old_space_size=4096
